reviews.review_msg: I recommend this prof to anyone! She is very kind and knowledgeable, and is passionate about what she does. Her grading is clear and she offers help to those in need. If you show up to lectures, do the readings and follow the criteria you will do really well.

I took her Central Asia course without knowing anything about it. If possible, try taking her Russian Foreign Policy course BEFORE Central Asia course - she is very passionate about both regions. At the end of the course, we did a roleplaying scenario where we pretended to be in a UN forum representing a country/org. It was stressful but helpful.

Nicole's lectures are a little bit boring but overall her grading is pretty fair, the course material is relevant, and she is helpful with papers and presentations and gives relevant feedback. I'm also taking her Russia foreign security class and all I can say is good things about her. I do not understand why her score is so low?
